message.content:
cs.CR, cs.IR, cs.DB, cs.LG, cs.CY 

This paper deals with the trade-off between privacy and economic reward in the context of personal data marketplaces. It discusses a mechanism that allows users to share their profile data with broker companies in exchange for an economic reward. This topic is relevant to several sub-categories of computer science, including cryptography (cs.CR), information retrieval (cs.IR), databases (cs.DB), machine learning (cs.LG), and computer and society (cs.CY). However, given the focus on privacy and security, cs.CR is the most likely sub-category, followed by cs.IR and cs.DB. The paper also discusses the use of Bregman divergences, which are commonly used in machine learning, hence cs.LG is also a likely sub-category. Finally, the paper addresses the societal implications of personal data marketplaces, which falls under the scope of cs.CY.
